intro: Diplodium microglossum, commonly known as the small-lipped diploid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and finely divided leaves. Native to certain regions of Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for ecological and horticultural study.
